DirectedGraph

Class DirectedGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • DirectedGraph.DirectedGraph

  • public class DirectedGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    A DirectedGraph models relationships between objects.
    A graph is composed of a set of Nodes (N) and Edges (E).
    Each edge e = (n1, n2) in E connects Node n1 to Node n2
    The edges are directed (one-way). So e = (n1, n2) means that there is a path from node n1 to n2, but not does not say whether there is a path from n2 to n1.

    Author:
    Janelle Van Hofwegen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectedGraph()

      DirectedGraph(java.util.List<Node> nodes, java.util.List<Edge> edges)
      Constructs a DirectedGraph containing the Nodes within list nodes, and all the edges within list edges.

      • nodeSet

        public java.util.Set<Node> nodeSet()
        Returns a set of all nodes contained in the graph.
        Returns:
        a set of all nodes in the graph. Returns an empty set if no edges are contained in graph.

        public void removeNode(Node n)

        Parameters:

        Modifies:

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(Edge e)
        Adds the given Edge to the graph. Given edge must be legal to be added to the graph; illegal edges will not be added. Also, the graph will not be modified if the given edge is already present within the graph.
        Parameters:
        e - - Edge to be added to the graph was not added.
        Modifies:
        this

      • containsEdge

        public boolean containsEdge(Edge e)
        Returns whether the given Edge is contained in the graph.
        Parameters:
        e - - Edge being searched for in the graph
        Returns:
        true if the given Edge is contained in the graph

      • removeEdge

        public void removeEdge(Edge e)
        Removes the given Edge from the graph. If given Edge is not present, has no effect on the graph.
        Parameters:
        e - - Edge to be removed from the graph

      • edgesOf

        public java.util.Set<Edge> edgesOf(Node n)
        Returns a set of all edges whose source is n. Therefore every edge e in the set follows the form e = (n, some other Node)
        Parameters:
        n - - the source Node for which a set of edges is being returned
        Returns:
        a set of all edges whose source is n. Returned set is empty if the node has no edges. Returns null if the node is not contained in the graph.
        Requires:
        that n is contained within the method
